titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 715: Compendium religiosi vivendi

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts Ms. Codex 715: Compendium religiosi vivendi are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. notesStmt.note: A leaf in a later hand with "Adorationes" is laid in between f. 64 and f. 65.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Miscellany probably used by a Carthusian[?] preacher. Comprised of the following tracts interspersed with prayers, a mass, and other liturgical matter, with blank leaves in between sections.

msItem.title: Excerpta de libro Sancti Augustini de spiritu et anima, f. 109r
Excerpta de libris Sancti Gregorii de triplici voce, f. 115r

supportDesc.extent: 132 leaves : 110 x 76 mm. bound to 112 x 75 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, 132; [1-132]; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto. Folios 6v-8v, 35r-40v, 52r-56r, 82r-82v, 86r-87r, 88v, 90v-92v, 93v-96r, 101v-108v, and 132r-132v are blank.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in various cursive scripts by many different hands.

decoDesc.decoNote: Some sections with rubrication (for example, f. 75r, 76r, 89r).
Reused manuscript leaf pastedown, Inside front cover
Reused manuscript leaf pastedown, Inside back cover

origin.p: Written in Austria[?] (Zacour-Hirsch) or northern Italy[?] in the 15th century.

history.provenance: Formerly owned by the Carthusian monastery at Buxheim (f. 9r), ms.V.88.h (f. 132v).

keywords.term: Catholic Church--Prayers and devotions--Early works to 1800
